silhouette.shapes
Interface DisplayManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
BagDisplay
public interface DisplayManager

The interface for all objects wishing to implement a DisplayManager for Silhouette objects. A display manager should be capable of drawing all the objects contained in a SilContainer object. Every Silhouette object contains two methods that a DisplayManager may need to use:

  1. draw: draws the shape on the display
  2. getBounds: returns a java.awt.Rectangle object that gives the rectangular bounds of the shape

Method Summary
 void display(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
          This method draws all the Shapes within a SilContainer.
 SilContainer getClient()
          This method returns the SilContainer handled by the display manager
 void redisplay(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
          This method draws all damaged Shapes within a SilContainer.
 DisplayManager setClient(SilContainer container)
          This method tells the display manager to start drawing the objects in container
 

Method Detail

getClient

public SilContainer getClient()
This method returns the SilContainer handled by the display manager

setClient

public DisplayManager setClient(SilContainer container)
This method tells the display manager to start drawing the objects in container

display

public void display(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
This method draws all the Shapes within a SilContainer. This method is meant to do a complete redraw of the entire container.

redisplay

public void redisplay(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
This method draws all damaged Shapes within a SilContainer. This method is meant to do an incremental redraw of the container.
